author: felixweber
title: Community Pool Network
description: Conseguir mais descentralização requer mais ferramentas de autogovernança para diferentes comunidades no ecossistema.

f6_assessments.q0:
Your Goal of Building a Network of SPO who support each other definitely addresses this challenge. I Strongly Agree.

"Therefore, a group of communities and projects in the Catalyst ecosystem have decided to join collective forces and build a network of pools with a general treasury to support emerging projects that target management, governance, and scalability tools at the community level."
f6_assessments.q1: The Ryuuki Network with 15 SPO operational, the Teams collective experience, a well defined budget and timeline. I Strongly Agree this proposal will be implemented.
f6_assessments.q2: Clearly defined Roadmap, KPI's / OKR's and Budget breakdown is more than sufficient to audit this proposal

f6_assessments.q0: I think the proposal is in line with the challenge, although not 100%, as it is not very clear to me the impact this may have on the challenge alignments.
f6_assessments.q1: I think the team behind the project, and the ryukii network (for the projects involved) is very complete, they have a great track record and the plan is quite simple, I don't think they will have many difficulties in developing the proposal, even more when they say they already have the pools operational.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal is simple and they provide KPIs to measure the impact and success of the proposal, however I do not see a vision of success for the next few months of development, so although it is a clear proposal, it is something that would be missing for a 5 star rating.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal offers a new way to support projects that have not passed the Catalyst funding model, which is very appreciated. It can give another new hope to qualified new projects out there or even a good Catalyst project that failed to get funding. However, this shouldn't be looked at as a direct competitor of Catalyst. It's a community initiative to support Cardano's development further.
f6_assessments.q1: The success likelihood is very high only by looking at the proposer's track record and involvement in many communities. But, the proposal doesn't mention how many team members are needed and responsible for valuing the project criteria to be voted according to the budget. How about the commitment to take part in this project? Consider this project is not based on periods like Catalyst and each member has their own community's activities already (in addition to their daily main jobs). The proposal doesn't disclose important information on how to manage financial transactions. For example, who will absorb the network fee? Is it going to be the project treasury or the funded project itself?
f6_assessments.q2: From the audit side, besides the main website, broader communities can look at the project progress on each community that supports it. Expect to have a continuation from this project on the next Catalyst funding. This proposal is a pilot project and only for the Q1 2022 period.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a daring attempt to establisg a governance model for network of networks (each network represented by a project which has associated a stake pool). It is an experimental approach that will give precious insight into new ways of governance that have not been tried before - the only way to innovate being indeed by "doing" when it comes to governance. If successful this can open doors to better social systems through ways to create effective citizen assemblies that can manage challenges much better than the current systems.
f6_assessments.q1: It is not easy to make a statement about success for such a high risk high reward proposal. What is however clear is the high level of dedication of the proposers and the fact that all the expertise there is in this regard - is in their hands! My wholehearted hope is that they will be successful. The world cannot wait much longer until a solution to the governance conundrum is found.
f6_assessments.q2: Everything will be transparent in this exciting experiment - so the lessons will be revealed "on the go".

f6_assessments.q0: The project has a practical idea to address the current problem that the SPOs with lesser funds and resources to against the well financial established SPOs. The proposal has highlighted the difficulty the small SPO or the inexperienced community member wishes to operate an SPO to address the issue. Ideally, as a Cardano community SPO member, I fully support your project with a grey vision to help a lower voice, less finance and make the Cardano network sustainable. Apart from supporting small community SPOs, it is also the critical skeleton component for the entirely Cardona ecosystem to run sustainable and security and mitigate centralisation and distributed denial-of-service (DDOS) network attacks.
f6_assessments.q1: The project is well documented and provides sufficient information on the team members but missing the details and deliverable items would be involved in three months. The proposer should have provided some hints or some basis calculation how intensive would be contribute into the finance and govern a community treasury module. For example, Catalyst Swarm, CC Admin Team, Bridge Builders are three out of all your community members that may have a lot of ADA members or followers, which means they possibly have a lot more delegators. So, your implementation module should at least provide design upfront to see whether it is feasible to join in or withdraw from the Ryuuki network. I believe you should stand 5 or 10% of the workload to work on the risk analysis of the entire project because it's related to many community networks and delegators or ADA holders.
f6_assessments.q2: With a $30,000 project request, I believe the proposer should provide a little more detail than a brief on what your team will do in the next three months if the project can obtain the funding. More precisely, KPI details so the challenge team of this challenge and community is easier to follow and report on your project work in progress.
